name: Python for Accounting
description: This is a three part introductory coding workshop series on the basics of using Python for Accounting/Finance purposes. These sessions train participants in using Python to download financial data, analysing data and visualising data by solving a series of tasks in teams by applying knowledge from online courses, using web searches and getting support from trainers. The libraries used in the workshops are pandas_datareader, pandas, matplotlib and seaborn.

alignment.targetDescription: Institute of Coding recognition of attendance

criteria.narrative:
This badge is awarded to people who have attended the following three python workshops, presented by the Digital Skills Lab at London School of Economics and Political Science:

Python for Accounting workshop 1: Practical online session in which participants worked through a series of tasks in teams. 
Tasks that participants were carrying out included:
-    downloading financial data from yahoo finance with pandas_datareader library
-    Creating single and multiple line plots with matplotlib
-    Customizing line plots with matplotlib

Python for Accounting workshop 2: Practical online session in which participants worked through a series of tasks in teams. 
Tasks that participants were carrying out included:
-    downloading financial data from yahoo finance with pandas_datareader
-    Transforming datasets/calculating new columns with pandas
-    Creating subplots with matplotlib
-    Customizing subplots with matplotlib

Python for Accounting workshop 3: Practical online session in which participants worked through a series of tasks in teams. 
Tasks that participants were carrying out included:
-    Using for loops 
-    Combining datasets with pandas
-    Aggregating datasets with pandas
-    Plotting barplots with seaborn
